data.title: Lint message for missing style image contains list-like formatting for a string.
data.body:
> Style style.pref_small['t']['y']['l']['e']['.']['p']['r']['e']['f']['_']['s']['m']['a']['l']['l'], property hover_background uses file 'ui/preferences/optionsmall_hover.png', which is not loadable. 

Probably related to the use of `str.capitalize`.

data.title: Signed-off-by: huanxuantian <huanxuantian@msn.cn>
data.body:
Chinese_Simplified translation for ren'py launcher
Created by huanxuantian
Translate by huanxuantian
Translation version 1.3.b
update to github on 2014-5-25 sun

data.title: Extract Dialogue ignores strings marked for translation in line after # character
data.body:
EDIT: Meant to title this 'Generate Translations', not 'Extract Dialogue'

Example:

```
define e = Character(_('Eileen'), color="#c8ffc8", what_prefix=_("“"), what_suffix=_("”"))
```

As the what_prefix and what_suffix strings appear after the # in color, they are not extracted when extracting dialogue for translation. The # character appears to be marking the remainder of text in that line as a comment to the dialogue extractor.

data.title: Windows 8 Display Scaling
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=26593

data.title: Added Italian translations for launcher and template
data.body:
I completely translated both the launcher and the template to Italian.

I did it without using any machine translation tools (I am a native Italian speaker) and I tried to keep it accurate, gender-neutral and yet idiomatic - I did not stray semantically from the original text but I tried to use Italian terms and expressions whenever possible. Many things (very few of them, actually) did not have a direct equivalent in Italian so I left those unchanged - Launcher is one of them, for example, as the literal translation "lanciatore" is rarely heard in a software context (it usually either means "missile launcher" or "baseball pitcher") any non-standard lingo would only lead to confusion.

I tried the translation in Ren'Py 6.17.6.512 and it loaded, worked and played correctly. If you have any questions, just ask.

data.title: reduce bgm volume during voice playing
data.body:
I added three config variables.

If config.reduce_volume_in_voice is True, the volumes of all the channels other than the "voice" channel are reduced to config.volume_in_voice in config.reduce_volume_time seconds during voice playing.

This gets voices to be easier to hear.

data.title: prevent _window_auto_callback from interfering voice system
data.body:
_window_auto_callback causes interactions, and they interfered voice system in some case.
For example.

```
    scene bg
    with dissolve

    voice "test.ogg"
    "test"
```

When "window auto" mode, "test.ogg" is played at the same time as a window begins to be shown. And the say statement stop the voice if preferences.voice_sustain is False.

voice_interact is made not to be called by _window_auto_callback by this pull request.

data.title: pass show_args to the 'nvl' screen
data.body:
About #347

show_args aren't be passed to the 'nvl' screen.
I allowed show_args to be passed the 'nvl' screen.

In the same page, the same show_arg is overwritten by later characters.

data.body: get_playing function doesn't return True. It returns the playing file name.

data.title: Add SetCharacterVolume
data.body:
This pull request allows the volume of each characters to be adjusted.

I added persistent._character_volume and SetCharacterVolume.

```
    def SetCharacterVolume(voice_tag, volume=None):
        """
        :doc: voice_action

        This allows the volume of each characters to be adjustment.
        If `volume` is None, this returns the value of volume of `voice_tag`.
        Otherwise, this set it to `volume`.

        `volume` is a number between 0.0 and 1.0, and is interpreted as a
        fraction of the mixer volume for `voice` channel.
        """
```

data.title: Default imagemap / imagebutton auto handler doesn't work with non-filename image names
data.body:
```
image b_hover = "b_hover.png"
image b_idle = "b_idle.png"
image b_insensitive = "b_insensitive.png"
image b_selected_hover = "b_selected_hover.png"
image b_selected_idle = "b_selected_idle.png"
screen new_main_menu:
  modal True
  imagebutton auto "b_%s" action Quit(confirm=False)
```

This does not work as 'auto' only allows filenames to be used to specify images, not image names. To use image names, each imagebutton/imagemap image must be specified manually.

data.title: Defaults for layer and zorder per tag.
data.body: The idea would be to have things like config.tag_layer['eileen'] = 'eileenlayer', and make that work.

data.title: Crashing on Mac with RTL enabled.
ATL Events are broken
data.body:
Code like:

```
transform foo:
    on hover:
        "#f00"
    on idle:
        "#0f0"

screen test2:
    vbox:

        button:
            action Return(True)
            add foo
            xysize (200, 200)
        button:
            action Return(True)
            add foo
            xysize (200, 200)
```

Doesn't seem to do what we'd expect it to.

data.title: A nvl screen can't take keyword arguments beginning with 'show_'
data.body:
I defined below character.
test = Character("test",  kind=nvl, show_test = True)

But nvl screen didn't have test variable.

data.title: auto parsing image files doesn't work with JCC (alpha+color JPGs)
data.body:
If I have in options:
    config.automatic_images=[ ' ', '_', '/' ]
    config.automatic_images_strip = ["fx","cgs","bgs"]
and I have .PNGs or .JPGs in the fx subfolder, they work fine, but if I try to convert them into alpha+color JPGs using jcc.rpy system, they're not found.

I use them in the code like this:
show fx candlelights
show fx fireplace

etc. and unless I explicitly define them "the old way" using image statement, they don't work, I get the classic "Image fx candlelights not found".

Not sure how easy is to fix, but it would be cool :) thanks

data.title: Warping to a Line
data.body:
The document about warping to a line is out of date.
renpy.sh doesn't take "--game" option and  example "./renpy.sh --game ./the_question/game/ --warp script.rpy:98" doesn't work correctly.

http://www.renpy.org/doc/html/developer_tools.html

data.title: Reload has bug.
data.body:
When config.save_directory is None, reloading game twice at the same position  causes game to return to main menu.

For example
1: Set config.save_directory to None.
2: Start tutorial.
3: Start game.
4: Reload game.
5: Reload game again

renpy v6.17.4.409

data.title: add DictValue
data.body:
Ren'Py doesn't have the BarValue which adjustments a dictionary.
And I added DictValue.

```
    class DictValue(BarValue):
        """
         :doc: value

         A value that allows the user to adjust the value of a key
         in a dict.

         `dict`
             The dict.
         `key`
             The key.
         `range`
             The range to adjust over.
         `max_is_zero`
             If True, then when the value of a key is zero, the value of the
             bar will be range, and all other values will be shifted down by 1.
             This works both ways - when the bar is set to the maximum, the
             value of a key is set to 0.

         `style`
             The styles of the bar created.
         `offset`
             An offset to add to the value.
         `step`
             The amount to change the bar by. If None, defaults to 1/10th of
             the bar.
```

data.title: transition inside a transform fails when interupted by a pause statement
data.body:
see this test project for a quick reproduction of the problem: https://www.mediafire.com/?t1dyux135xy5baa

it shows the same animation 3 times but with a different length pause each time. the pause has nothing to do with the animation/transform; it is called from a label whereas the animation is part of a screen shown earlier.
first it shows the transition completely blocked. the 2nd it is interrupted. the 3rd the transition completes as normal.

data.title: Cannot create or jump to labels which begin with numbers
data.body:
The Ren'Py parser returns an error when it encounters a label which begins with a number. A sample output is below: 
I'm sorry, but errors were detected in your script. Please correct the
errors listed below, and try again.

File "game/script.rpy", line 3: expected 'name' not found.
    jump 01_se_01_start
         ^

File "game/scripts/01_se_01.rpy", line 1: expected 'name' not found.
    label 01_se_01_start:
          ^

Ren'Py Version: Ren'Py 6.17.4.409

data.title: autosave before load
data.body:
Now loading loses unsaved progress, but then autosave isn't done.
Ren'Py will also do autosave before FileLoad.
